notes: Three members of the Ijaw militia were shot dead by troops as they stormed an oil administrators office demanding compensation.
Ijaw youths seized a boat with 17 Chevron employees, and held six Nigerian passengers captive
the Idimu chapter of the Oodua Peoples Congress (OPC) embarked on a peaceful protest against the current increase in the pump price of petroleum products
Personal Assistant to former Communications Minister, Brig. General David Mark (RTD) was shot at Oturkpo by people suspected to be hired assassins
At least 20 people have died in a renewed clash over oil rights when 10 boats belonging to ethnic Ijaws were sunk by their rival neighbours, the Ilajes
Ethnic groups clash over the period of a week
Non-violent activity: Isoko youths takeover Shell flow station in Delta State.
On 26 December, 15 suspected rebels from Chad and Niger, disguised as herdsmen, attacked some villagers at Umguwar Yabo village, Danki in Zamfara State, with guns. Injuries reported, but no deaths.

Thousands of civil servants barricaded the main gate of Government House Port Harcourt and held the state military administrator, Group Capt. Sam Ewang, hostage for several hours to protest the dismissal of five of their leaders by the state government
Following an attack on a village in Zamfara, police pursued and a gun battle broke out, resulting in two policemen being injured.
Office of the Independent National Electoral Commission in Oju Local Government in Benue state burnt down by people suspected to be opposition supporters
A group of armed robbers break into the home of an army captain, shoot him dead and loot the house. "

protesting workers in the state hurled stones at the wife of Chief of General Staff, Mrs. Akhigbe and stoned the official car of the Secretary to the State Government, Mr. Babarinde da Silva. The workers were protesting the non-payment of the N5,200 new minimum wage and the sacking of their leader, Mr. Ayodele Akele last October
A three-month-old baby boy, his brother, mother and father were beheaded during a communal clash on the Opa River."
A former communications minister in the Second Republic, Chief Audu Ogbe was at the early hours of yesterday shot by assassins at his home but survived
Four soldiers suspected to be hired to obstruct the election, were arrested after assaulting election officials
an inebriated policeman was beaten to death by a crowd after he shot dead a dispatch rider from the state governors office
Six are killed at a polling station when groups of two rival political parties become violent.
Royal Dutch/Shell shuts in large quantities of oil to protect the commodity from rioters on Bonny Island. This action has drastically effected the output leading to shortages.
two hundred lawyers staged a peaceful protest demanding the immediate action by the stage government in providing the facilities for the establishment of a Court of Appeal Division in Calabar
Government workers in Enugu State protest the refusal of the state government to pay them the N5,200 national minimum wage
Supporters of rival political parties clashed ahead of elections, several were injured
Twenty fishermen from a small community in southwest Nigeria were killed last week by armed men from a rival community
Shell Oil has shut down sections of a key crude oil pipeline in Nigeria after workers trying to seal a leak were attacked by stone-throwing villagers
Fighting this week between the Benekuku and Utagbaogbe communities reportedly began as a dispute over the use of development aid donated to the area from a foreign oil company
Degree conferment ceremony disrupted by a violent protest by students over the presence of one of the Abacha-for-president campaigners, Alhaji Azeez Arisekola Alao, at the occasion
two secondary school cults clashed with bottles and machetes at of the African School, St. Joseph Catholic School and St Peters College
Fresh clash between warring ethnic communities leaves 10 critically wounded
A militant group kidnapped seven foreign oil workers from a Texaco oil rig and demanded they should be compensated monetarily for the oil produced in the region.
A group of oil workers including a Briton an American and a Nigerian were abducted by members of the Ijaw militia but were soon released. "
Four people including the leader of the OPC were killed by police forces when they were demonstrating without authorization."
Angry workers of the Ikeja local government this morning chased armed policemen from the premises during a protest against the reinstatement of tax consultants into the service of the council
A group of assassins killed a leader in the Ijaw militia.

Police fired their weapons into the air in order to disperse a large gathering of Shiite Muslims protesting the detention of their leader; four wounded.

armed youths ambushed the vehicles of 100 workers from Shell, Texaco and Westminster Dredging, and held them hostage for two hours while they "screened for Ijaws" after an Itsekiri village was burned down

police force applicants began to protest after non-indigenes of Lagos state were told to leave the scene and go to their respective states of origin for recruitment

Around 100 protestors staged a brief demonstration outside the Belgian embassy in Lagos on Friday over the death of a Nigerian immigrant last month during an incident involving Belgian police

Residents of at least nine villages in border area of Borno state are reportedly being held hostage by the rebel groups from Chad as a shield against attacks by the joint force of Nigeria, Chad and Niger.

Property destruction: Several oil flow stations have been purposefully damaged by vandals in the Delta region disrupting output by as much as one fifth. Following the destruction the group then seized two helicopters owned by the Shell corporation.

Property destruction: youths attacked four flow stations in Nembe Creek and shut down three flow stations in the west of the delta

Five policemen sent to maintain peace are killed during communal clashes in Apato
Three are dead in a clash between a group of fuel tanker drivers and police when a trivial argument got out of hand.

One Ilaje chief beheaded and three others kidnapped in a communal clash in Ondo State over a piece of land believed to be rich in oil
13 Shiite Muslim protesters seeking the release of their incarcerated leader were shot and killed by police while others were arrested. "

Families of detained managers of failed banks protested to seek "justice and fair play....and trials" for those detained
Four members of a family were killed by a group of armed men outside of Lagos.
Police assault a journalist , killing him (unintentionally), reported a press advocacy group

14 are dead following a riot that was sparked off due to the extortion of a soldier.
Police put down sporadic protests against General Abdulsalam Abubakar the newly appointed military ruler.

A group known as the ""Concerned Ilaje Citizens"" took hostages aboard an oil platform shut the platform down and demand 10 million naira for their release. "

Police arrest 19 students who were organizing a protest against the military dictatorship.
